result.execSummary:
The defendant Terrell D Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The Court ordered restitution at this time in the stipulated amount of $685.73 payable to Betty B.--to be paid first. Additional restitution request may be forthcoming.

Pay all applicable mandatory surcharges, fees, assessments, and costs--paid after restitution. Pay all supervision fees. The Court ordered that all financial obligations and restitution be paid through collection of sums by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

The defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program AFTER SERVING THE FIRST YEAR OF THIS SENTENCE
Consecutive to: any other time being served with credit for 0 days served.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obtain/maintain full time employment or full time school and part time employment.
Obtain GED or HSED.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: Firearm possession and Voting.

No drug dealing or association with drug community (drug users/dealers or drug houses).
No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No contact with victim Betty B., her family or her residecnt at 3961 N 23rd.

Obtain Mental Health assessment and successfully complete follow-up treatment. 
Take any prescription medication only in the manner/dosage as prescribed by a treatming physician.
Participate with random urine screens.
Cooperate with any and all rules set forth by the probation agent.
Participate in Cognitive thinking program.
Provide DNA sample if not previously done so--pay surcharge.
Obtain AODA assessment and if necessary successfully complete follow-up treatment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Terrell D Johnson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript SENTENCING HEARING (42 pages) commencing SEPTEMBER 30, 2014 received and filed.

Defendant Terrell D Johnson in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant Terrell D Johnson in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

The defendant was advised of his/her constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.  Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statement made by Betty B.  Issue of restitution addressed.  Due to the lateness of the hour (noon) case adjourned.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Anne A. Devitt in court, defendant Terrell D Johnson not in court, in custody (MSDF).  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Status conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in negotiations.  Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Anne A. Devitt in court, defendant Terrell D Johnson not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Status conference held between counsel.  Parties report that revocation proceedings for the defendant have been postponed.  The outcome of said proceedings will impact on negotiations in this matter.  Joint request for adjournment granted by the court.  Status conference scheduled for August 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Anne A Devitt in court, defendant Terrell D Johnson not in court, in custody.  Megan P Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations.   Defendant has pending revocation proceedings.  Status conference scheduled for July 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Anne A Devitt in court, defendant Terrell D Johnson not in court, in custody and not produced.  Megan P Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case set for scheduling conference.   Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of PRELIMINARY HEARING commencing 3-26-2014 received and filed. (13 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to Attorney Anne Devitt 819 N 6th Street Milwaukee WI

Defendant Terrell D Johnson in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant Terrell D Johnson in custody.   Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Steven Roeglin-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court.  Court enters a not guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Terrell D Johnson in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant Terrell D Johnson in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case was calendared for this morning, and an officer was present.  Defense Attorney was not aware the case was scheduled for today and did appear this afternoon.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 26, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Betty B

Defendant Terrell D Johnson in court with Student Intern Zachariah Fudge under the supervision of attorney Christian T. Eichenlaub.  Defendant Terrell D Johnson in custody.  Michael Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
